title: Haddo House Country Park Walks

images.title: JThomas / Haddo House
images.caption: View of the gardens and house. Haddo House is one of the most beautiful stately homes open to the public in Scotland.

images.title: Martyn Gorman / Redwoods at Haddo House.
images.caption: Redwoods at Haddo House. These two majestic redwoods were planted by Queen Victoria and Prince Albert when they visited Haddo House.

images.title: Sarah Charlesworth / Tree-lined approach to Haddo House
images.caption: Tree-lined approach to Haddo House

images.title: Martyn Gorman / Raxton farm, Haddo House, Aberdeenshire
images.caption: Raxton farm, Haddo House, Aberdeenshire. Autumn countryside after several days of heavy rain. The farm sits across the road from the entrance to the park.

description: Explore the beautiful estate of Haddo House on this lovely walk in Aberdeenshire. A number of footpaths will take you around the 100 hectare grounds where you will find a formal terrace garden, lakes, monuments, woodland and a deer park.

details.subtitle: Pubs/Cafes
details.content: There's an on site National Trust tea room where you can enjoy refreshments after your walk. It includes a lovely garden area where you can sit outside and enjoy a meal or snack if the weather is fine.

details.subtitle: Dog Walking
details.content: The parkland around the house is a fine place for a dog walk. There's even a dog park for them to run around in, and a new outdoor dog agility trail. Please do keep them under close control at all times.

details.subtitle: Further Information and Other Local Ideas
details.content: The nearby Fyvie Castle is another lovely place for a walk in the area. The 13th century castle includes splendid grounds with beautiful gardens, woodland trails and the picturesque Fyvie Loch. Near here there's also Gight Castle. There's some nice trails along the Ythan River and the Braes of Gight near this impressive 16th century ruin. Leith Hall Gardens is another good local option.

display_address: Scots Mile, Aberdeenshire, Alba / Scotland, AB41 7EQ, United Kingdom
